meanings.definition: A person who trains and directs athletes or performers.
meanings.sent1: The coach helped the team improve their skills.
meanings.sent2: The basketball coach led the team to victory.
meanings.sent3: The coach's whistle was so loud, it scared the birds away.
meanings.sent4: She was a coach, guiding her students through the challenges of the performance.
meanings.sent5: The coach's encouraging words stayed with the players long after the game.

meanings.sent1: The coach was beautifully decorated for the royal parade.
meanings.sent2: The coachman drove the elegant coach through the streets.
meanings.sent3: The coach looked like it came straight out of a fairy tale.
meanings.sent4: The coach rolled smoothly along the cobblestone road.
meanings.sent5: The coach's wheels creaked softly as it traveled through the countryside.

meanings.sent1: She will coach the new employees on company policies.
meanings.sent2: He decided to coach his son in playing the guitar.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to coach the cat on how to catch a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The experienced teacher knew how to coach her students to success.
meanings.sent5: He would coach her patiently until she mastered the dance routine.
